intro: Lindernia satakei, commonly known as the Satake's Lindernia, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. Lindernia satakei is often found in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
